etymology.description: 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") + 各(各) (gè, "each") = soil/earth divided by territory -> phonetic component
etymology.interpretation: The character 圥(lù) combines 土(土) for its connection to earth or territory with 各(各) to imply division or distribution, used primarily as a phonetic component.

examples.chinese: 在汉字中(在漢字中)，圥是一个表示音的偏旁(圥是一個表示音的偏旁)。
examples.pinyin: Zài hànzì zhōng, lù shì yīgè biǎoshì yīn de piānpáng.
examples.english: In Chinese characters, 圥 functions as a phonetic component.

examples.chinese: 学者研究古文字时(學者研究古文字時)，将圥视作表音符号(將圥視作表音符號)。
examples.pinyin: Xuézhě yánjiū gǔwénzì shí, jiāng lù shì zuò biǎoyīn fúhào.
examples.english: When scholars study ancient scripts, they regard 圥 as a phonetic symbol.
